COMMENT1: Note If you are not going to use the `npm run autowatch` command to compile, then delete the macOS.minVersion line below
plugin.name: ⭐️ Favorites
plugin.description: Get fast access to commonly-used notes. Set any Project Note(s) as a Favorites and have quick access to choose/open the file
plugin.author: @dwertheimer
plugin.lastUpdateInfo:
1.2.3: Minor change to the favorite command prepending.
1.2.2: Usability fix: allow for escaping and leaving command intact.
1.2.1: Add rename capability.
1.2.0: Add prepended characters for favorite saved commands & xcallback creator inline. Thx for the idea @clayrussell!
1.1.0: Add capability to set a preset to run a favorite URL/X-Callback
plugin.url: Put a link to a web page or your github readme file here, and it will be displayed as the 'website' in the plugin preference pane to give users more info on the plugin before/after install, e.g.  https://github.com/dwertheimer/Noteplan-plugins/blob/main/np.plugin-flow-skeleton/readme.md

plugin.commands.name: faves - Choose+Open Favorite (⭐️) Note
plugin.commands.description: Open one of the saved Favorites

plugin.commands.name: fave - Make this Note a Favorite (⭐️)
plugin.commands.description: Set open Note to be a Favorite (add ⭐️)

plugin.commands.name: unfave - Remove this Note from Favorites List (⭐️)
plugin.commands.description: Remove this Note from saved Favorites (remove ⭐️ from name)

plugin.commands.name: Set/Change/Rename Preset Action
plugin.commands.description: Add or edit a preset to run a favorite URL/X-Callback

plugin.commands.name: x-Test Preset Settings Migration
plugin.commands.description: Test auto migration of presets; use this URL to test:

plugin.settings.COMMENT: This is for use by the editSettings helper function. PluginID must match the plugin.id in the top of this file

plugin.settings.title: Characters to Prepend to Command
plugin.settings.description: If there are characters like “-☆” in front of each command, it will keep them together and float them to the top of the menu. Whatever text you put here will be prepended to any command name you set. Blank this field out to not prepend any characters. No spaces will be added after text you put in this box, so if you want a space, add it to the text box.

plugin.settings.title: Preset 01
plugin.settings.description: Do not change this setting manually. Use the "/Change Favorite Preset" command.
